item.title: Litter along curb and pavement of White Hart Road, 8th July
item.description:
There is litter and food waste along the pavement and curb. Shellfish has been thrown along the pavement, attracting vermin. There is always rubbish along this road, can the street cleaner come around more often or can a public bin be put on the pavement?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hart Road, Goddington, London

item.title: Overgrown Conservation Area next to fence, 8th July
item.description:
There is a conservation area/wasteland as part of the allotment gardens. It is never maintained and has been left to grow for the last 50 years. I know this as my parents bought this house then and there were no trees or growth. Now there are alot of trees that are very tall and covered in ivy, these move alot in the wind and one fell over earlier in the year. There is also ivy and nettles that keep coming through and over the top of our fence. We have complained before and the ivy and nettles were cut down but they have just grown back. We have had to renew our fence because of this and don't want to have to do it again. Could the trees be checked and lopped and the ivy and nettles be chopped back .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Longlands Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
